dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CRYO-LOCKER BLOWS OPEN, spitting out... CAROLYN FRY. She hits the deck of the main cabin: Four cr lockers in a forward section, countless more in back. But deck is canted at a sick angle and ALARMS SCREAM everywhe The world is dying around her. Legs wobbly, shivering like a flu victim, Fry stumbles to next forward locker. It's riddled with holes. One DEAD CR is seen through fractured plexi, body pocked and bloodied in the next cryo-locked... The CAPTAIN is struggling awake. Fry's face floods with r Slapping an intercom:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear me? Cap'n? Some kinda compromise to the hull...holding for now, but...Goddamn, I'm glad you're alive. Gotta pull your E-release...no, red handle, red handle. I'll get the warm-ups out while -- PHFUT-PHFUT-PHFUT-PHFUT: Particles bore through the cabin blasting open the captain's chest, shattering plexi, DETO INSTRUMENTS on the opposite wall and leaving CONTRAILS HISSING in the air. Fry lands on her ass, horrified. Suddenly... Another LOCKER BLOWS OPEN. A body falls right on top of F but this one's still alive. Disoriented, frantic:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why did I fall on you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's dead. Cap'n's dead. Christ, I was looking right at him when --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I mean, chrono shows we're 22 weeks out, so gravity wasn't supposed to kick in for another 19. I mean, I mean, I mean, why did I fall at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hear me? Captain's dead. Owens too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. Not Owens, not.... Wai', wai', wait. I'm Owens. Right? They swap nightmare looks, momentarily unsure of their ow identities.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cryo-sleep. Swear to God, it sloughs brain cells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stumble into nav-bay. ALARMS CONTINUE. Fry grabs war suits out of storage, pitches one to Owens, checks her sc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 1550 millibars, dropping 20 MB per minute, shit, we're hemorrhaging air. Somethin' took a swipe at us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just tell me we're still in the shipping lane. Just show me all those stars, all those bright, beautiful, deep-space.... Owens activates an exterior view: A planet rushes up at u That's why they have gravity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus God....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SHIP PLOWS through the upper atmosphere, antennae pyl already disintegrating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heart battering her ribs, Fry runs forward, using hand-ho steady herself. Over a headset:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They trained you for this, right? Fry?

dialogues.speaker: FRY
dialogues.text: She doesn't answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fry harnesses in, starts running switches -- but fumbles times, making mental errors. Finally she gets crash-shutt open to reveal... CLOUD STRATA sweeping up past the windscreen like floor-l on a dropping elevator. We're shedding big altitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... crisis program selected Number Two of this system because it shows at least some oxygen and more than 1,500 -- would you

dialogues.speaker: SHUT THE FUCK UP
dialogues.text: (hammers a button, SILENCES ALARMS)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- more than 1,500-millibars of pressure at surface-level. Okay, so maybe the ship did something right for a change....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Fry runs more switches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As JETTISON DOORS CLOSE around the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Fry flips up a security-latch -- and thumbs the switch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MULTIPLE SHOTS: EXPLOSIVE BOLTS RAPID-FIRE around the shi skin, blowing away non-essentials that hinder aerodynamic including big deep-space drives. But this last separation the ship into a dangerous roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out the windscreen, cloud strata roll vertiginously. Fry actuators...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And airbrakes deploy. She manages to kill the roll. But t ship's still coming in nose-high.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...showing no major water bodies...maximum terrain, 220 meters over mean surface... largely cinder and gypsum with some evaporite deposits.... JETTISON DOORS CLOSE behind Owens, segregating him from t passenger compartment. It scares him for a new reason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fry? What're you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fry flips up a new security-latch. INTERCUTTING:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't get my nose down...too much load back there....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean that "load" of passengers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what, we should both go down too? Out of sheer fucking nobility? Tortured silence. Fry's thumb moves to the switch that wi jettison the passenger cabin. Jettison 50 people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SELECTED SHOTS of faces inside cryo-lockers, among them J He's prime-of-life, badge on display, some kind of cop. S awake, he clears condensation to check the locker directl from his, finding... RIDDICK. Small black goggles hide his eyes. A metal bit w in his mouth lends a perpetual grimace. A read-out admoni

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Fry. Company says we're responsible for every one of those --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Company's not here, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When captain went down, you stepped up -- whether you like it or not. Now they train you for this, so --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And there wasn't a simulated cockroach alive within 50 clicks of the simulated crash site! That's how they train you! On a fucking simulator! Owens unbuckles from his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch that switch! Overcome by guilt, Fry retracts her thumb of mass destruc But a HUGE JOLT puts the thumb right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not dying for them. She pushes it. But this time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No bolts fire. Nothing separates from the SHIP THAT SCREA through the clouds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now we see why: Owens reopened the jettison doors locally blocked them open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 70 seconds! You still got 70 seconds to level this beast out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seething anger and guilt, Fry pops more airbrakes, sheddi speed, more heat. The ship does level -- but it's still b pounded hellishly. She tries to get a stable view out... The windscreen. We're breaking through cloud-bottoms. The just a glimpse of landscape before...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An airbrake fails. It shears off and pinwheels into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windscreen. It cracks into a thousand spiderwebs -- b impossibly it holds. For now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the shit was that? Sunlight flares from every fractured edge: It's like look into burning diamonds, and Fry can only get an impression of the outside world. Now she has to rely on... A ground-mapping display. 120 meters altitude. And droppi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT Johns. Realizing he's in some kind of shit-storm claws at safety restraints.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ground-mapper: 60 meters. COLLISION ALARMS kick in. Out the fractured windscreen, we see a huge dark mass ris into view. Land. 40 meters...30...20...10.... Fry braces. IMPACT. The WINDSCREENS IMPLODE. AIR HURRICANES in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IMPACT. Chairs rip from their moorings. Strapped into one Owens slams into the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IMPACT. Johns BLOWS OUT of his locker -- and wishes to Go would've stayed inside, because just beside him... The hull is cracking open. NIGHTMARE SHOT: A huge section of the cabin tears free... skitters and CRASHES along the planetfloor behind us...an disintegrates out of sight. 40 cryo-lockers vanished with 40 lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hammered by WIND, Fry opens her eyes experimentally. FRY'S POV: A vortex of motion, of speed, of blurring debr But the ship is burrowing in. Burrowing under. Fry pivots her chair 180 degrees a nanosecond before... Dirt avalanches into the cockpit. It buries CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Choking yellow dust. Ghostly silhouettes are COUGHING, MO CALLING OUT to other survivors in English and, surreally, Arabic. Soon we find... Johns. Ears running blood. Stumbling his way to... Riddick's cryo-locker. Empty. Johns reaches for his holst Gone, torn right off his belt. No prisoner and no weapon spooky combination. Nearby he sees... The light of a cutting torch. Someone's using it to open jammed cryo-locker. The plexi is torched away to reveal.. AUDREY, 12 years old. Unscathed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somethin' went wrong, huh? Johns searches for his pistol. Behind him, two chained fe lower into FRAME -- and then attack, swinging over Johns' getting the chain on his neck...twisting hard, using the a choke-collar. Johns flicks open a baton, swings it up a Riddick. Still in body chains and mouth-bit. Clinging to ceiling support. Riding out the baton blows. Seconds from blacking out, Johns strains forward...forwar finally breaks Riddick's grip on the support. He keeps ho the chained feet so that... Riddick SLAMS HEADFIRST into the deck. Johns lays the bat his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One chance and you blew it, Riddick. Never cease to disappoint me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darkness. A light beam sweeps the dusty air of the cockpi It's packed with dirt, no signs of life. About to search elsewhere, Johns turns back at...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, me. Over here. His light finds a headrest sticking up from the dirt. Joh crawls closer, checks the other side of the headrest and her. Fry. Buried to the gills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing. I'm Johns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carolyn Fry. I'd shake hands, but... He manages a smile and starts digging her out. Almost dre to ask:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are there any others, Johns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johns helps Fry through the carnage. She's stunned by it but especially by the blast of sunlight where a hull used Realizing she's in nav-bay, Fry starts digging like a sea to uncover... Owens. Still strapped to his chair. Metal rod piercing hi chest close to the heart. Dead. Fry reaches out to touch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out, out, out, GET IT OUTTA ME! She recoils hard. He's still alive. The other survivors b over. Ten seconds of pure chaos:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pull it out of him...No, it's too close to the heart...You gotta do it, just do it fast.... Fry grabs the rod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch it! Don't touch that switch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll kill him, I'm tellin' you, shit, just leave it alone...delirious...doncha you got some drugs for this poor man....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't touch that switch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awright, awright, someone...there's Anestaphine in the med-lock, that end of the cabin...next to.... But there is no more "that end." In exquisite pain, Owens screams on. REACTION SHOTS of Johns, Audrey. Seldom are h beings witness to such raw suffering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away. Everybody. The others leave -- except for Audrey, staying behind to in morbid fascination. Johns doubles back and collars her Leaving, they pass... Riddick, cuffed to a bulkhead. His eyes, still hidden by goggles, track Johns and Audrey toward daylight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The survivors straggle outside. CAMERA SURVEYS new faces: ZEKE and SHAZZA. Male-female team of bushwhackers, partne life. Shazza has a tough sexiness. Zeke's face shows abor blood. (30s.) PARIS. Overfed, overgroomed. A puff pastry of a man. (40s 50s.) Four male "Chrislams": The pillar-steady IMAM (50ish), an THREE PILGRIMS, young and excitable (late-teens). (NOTE: Chrislams represent a union between Christianity and Isla have the iconography of Christians yet the physical look Muslims.) WIDE SHOT: All around them is stark and unforgiving terra The valley floor is relieved only by low hills to one sid spiked with earthen spires. Scorching down on everything two suns -- one red, one yellow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well. Our own little slice of heaven. The Chrislams fall to their knees. Confusion as they try orient themselves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...which way to New Mecca? We must know the direction in order to pray. North? South? East? West? Nobody knows. Johns snaps open compass, finds the needle swaying rudderlessly. The SCREA inside the ship finally ends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Fry holds Owens, now dead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four Chrislams have devised a way to pray: Backs toge each faces a different compass point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fry climbs onto the back of the ship. Johns Paris, Zeke, Audrey are already here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big talk about a scouting party... Fry sees the huge smoldering scar in the ground behind th One glance confirms that there are no other survivors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...then we saw this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anyone else having breathing problems? Aside from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I just ran, or something....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Feel one lung short. All of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I tend toward the asthmatic. And with all this dust.... Faces turn to Fry: They're looking to her for answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the atmosphere. Too much pressure, not enough oxygen. Might take a few days to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what the bloody hell happened, anyways?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somethin' knocked us off-lane. Maybe a rogue comet. Maybe we'll never know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I for one, am thoroughly fucking grateful. This beast wasn't made to land like this. But cripes, you rode it down. (to others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, you lousy ingrates, only reason we're alive is a'cuzza her. Others CHIME AGREEMENT, laying thankful hands on Fry's sh HOLD on Fry, her face betraying nothing as they anoint he savior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breaking out pressure suits:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Liquid oxygen canisters inside. Start ripping them out. Quick hits only -- try to make it last.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, is someone coming for us? Or are we all just gonna die of exposure or dehydration or sunstroke or maybe even something worse? (off their looks)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you don't have to worry about scaring me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're worried you'll scare us. (ushering her away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name's "Audrey," right, love? And you're goin' to Taurus Three like we were?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but...do we even have enough food to get there? Or will we have to resort to cannibalism?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see 'bout makin' this air go a bit further, cap'n. With your permission, a' course. Fry blinks. "They actually think I'm the captain." others get to work. Fry finds herself staring at another problem. Riddick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big Evil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just keep him locked up forever?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be my choice. Already escaped once from the max-slam facility on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need his life story. Is he really that dangerous?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only around humans. Riddick has his mouth on the hull, virtually licking the Fry moves closer -- and now sees it sheeting down the hul

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Christ.... They're losing water. Suddenly Fry is running, snatching emergency light, climbing wall-rungs...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And crawling through dusty superstructure to reach the wa cistern. She opens a crank-hatch -- and finds light invad interior. Her face dies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well? Is it just the pump?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ask if anyone has anything in cargo! Anything to drink!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oversize DOORS RUMBLE open. Fry, Johns, and Paris climb i this dark corridor lined with cargo containers. Each cont has an access door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine here.... As Paris unlocks, Johns steadies himself, suddenly light-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: S'matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little swamp-flu from the Conga system. Never shook it with all this cryo-sleep. Paris opens his container to reveal...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tiffany chairs stacked 10 high. Bronze eagle lecterns. Or umbrellas. Neo-Egyptian castings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: King Tut's tomb....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be surprised what these will fetch in the Taurus system. Here. This Wooten here -- easy, easy. Very rare. They open the Wooten desk. Cubbyholed inside are dusty bo of sherry. Vintage Port. Glenfiddich. Bicardi 151.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it? Booze? That's what you have to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (educating her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 200-year-old single-malt scotch is to "booze" as foie gras is to "duck guts."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cracking a bottle)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A toast to whatever he just said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll need a receipt for that. (to Fry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For all these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Top of my list. She joins Johns for a drink. Entering, the Chrislams watc both envy and aversion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't suppose....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the Christian habits we didn't adopt -- perhaps unfortunately. We'll have to wait.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? There is no water. You understand that, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All deserts have water, somewhere. God shall lead us there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: START on the cutting torch, abandoned in wreckage. Starin is... Riddick. With his hands cuffed behind him and around a bu he can't get near it. Or can he? Near the ceiling, the bu is fractured -- a slim spot where maybe chains could pass Riddick stands. With a GRUESOME POPPING, he dislocates bo shoulders...carries his arms overhead...passes the chains the broken spot...and brings his arms down in front of hi body-flex POPS HIS SHOULDERS back into joint. Free, he reaches for the cutting torch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pistol in hand, Johns runs into a BIG CLOSEUP, eyes sweep Nothing on the horizon. But something lies on the ground It's Riddick's mouth-bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like we needed another way to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FAST CLOSEUPS: Hands pillaging storage lockers, pulling o anything that might qualify as a "weapon." It all gets ha back and dumped into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nav-bay. Gathered, the survivors take inventory: Johns ha pistol, shotgun, baton. Zeke and Shazza offer up a pick-a digging tools, hunting boomerang. Imam shows a ceremonial Paris straggles in with antique curios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell are these?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maratha crow-bill war-picks from Northern India. Very rare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An' this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blow-dart hunting stick from Papua New Guinea. Very very rare, since the tribe's extinct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cuz they couldn't hunt shit with these things, be my guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what's the need, anyway? If he's gone, he's gone. Why should he bother us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First, because he can only live out there for so long -- he's gonna come back and take what we got. Second, for the sheer thrill of the kill. A beat. They all grab for weapons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johns stands atop the crash ship, scanning with a scope. fixates on... A blue glow on the horizon. "What the hell is it?" Zeke and Shazza modify breather units, adding straps and and ball-floats. The prototype is tested on Audrey. She s on the mouthpiece -- and finds that it works, supplying o demand rather than in a constant flow. Chrislams convert to traditional bedouin head-gear, ready travel. Fry finishes wrapping Owens' body. She looks to the yello low on the horizon. The red sun seems inclined to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imam. We should leave soon. Before nightfall but while it's cooler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you're goin' off, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johns is leaving you a gun. Just do me a favor, huh? Get my crewies buried? They were good guys who died bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A'course we will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imam...Imam.... (NOTE: "Imam" is pronounced "el-ee-MAM.") Fry and the others round the ship to see... A blue star flaring into view. It's rising as the other s setting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My bloody oath....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three suns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for your nightfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So much for my cocktail hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We take this to be a good sign -- a path, a direction from God. Johns swings down from the top of the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very good sign. (re: blue sun)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's Riddick's direction. You do not wanna be caught in the dark with this guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you found his restraints over there. Toward sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which means he went toward sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trekking, the Chrislams waft incense pots and CHANT FROM THE KORAN as they head toward the blue star. Johns provid shotgun escort; Fry carries Paris' second war-pick on a s Silhouetted against the alien sky, the scouting party is odd sight. Already sun-battered, Johns crafts an eye-visor out of pl Fry tries to wrap her head like the Chrislams. Imam helps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So quiet. You get used to the sounds of the ship, then....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know who Muhammad was?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some prophet guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Some prophet guy." And a city man. But he had to travel to the desert -- where there was quiet -- to hear the words of God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were on a pilgrimage? To New Mecca?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nodding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chrislam teaches that once in every lifetime should there be a great hajj -- a great pilgrimage. To know God, better, yes, but to know yourself as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frightening thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finishes wrapping her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all on the same hajj now. Fry notices Johns scope-locked on something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands her scope)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me it's not a mirage. SCOPE POV: Beyond a distant rise, strange branches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trees?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris has taken over as look-out atop the ship. He deals the heat by erecting a "misting" umbrella: He fills a res with liquor, dials up a regulator. Umbrella spars shoot b of cooling alcohol vapor. Paris luxuriates in it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comfy up there? Zeke appears below. He loads a scrap-metal sled with tarp cable, pick-ax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amazing how you can do without the essentials of life -- so long as you have the luxuries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, just keep your bloody-fuckin' eyes open. Don't want that ratbag sneakin' up on me bloody-fuckin' arse. He drags the sled toward the spired hills. Keeping one ey Zeke, Paris eases into a chair, lays the war-pick across pours himself a spot of sherry. As he sips, a blade touch throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd probably get you right here, right under the jaw. And you'd never hear him coming. That's how good Riddick is. Paris eases the hunting boomerang away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now did you run away from your parents? Or did they run away from you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scouting party approaches a rise. The trees loom just

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allahu Akbar...Allahu Akbar.... The young pilgrims break into a excited run, anticipating oasis. But Fry hangs back, taking a harder look at the tr They don't move in the wind. The pilgrims scramble up the rise -- and go motionless. F Johns and Imam catch up to behold... The "trees" are actually the dorsal bones of a titanic sk tinted green by lichen. Beyond is a sea of bleached anima bones. Impossibly, the bones seem to MOAN IN PAIN. All to it's like Hell overflowed right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this whole planet dead? A pilgrim questions Imam IN ARABIC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asks what could have killed so many great things...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving into the boneyard:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some...communal graveyard, perhaps... like the elephants of Earth.... Fry touches one of the towering bones. It shows cut-marks almost as if the bone was hacked by a sword. "Graveyar killing field?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long time ago. Whatever happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pilgrim #1 reaches a huge skull laced with baleen-like co Wind hitting the comb makes a LOW HARMONIC MOANING. By moving a hand over the comb, the pilgrim can "play" DIRGE MUSIC. Wanting to show off the trick:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah.... He looks for Pilgrim #3 but can't spot him. And when he t back to the skull -- a face is staring through the combin it's only...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pilgrim #3, inside the skull. Johns enters and chases him About to leave, Johns notices... Bone-chippings piled on the ground. It could be nothing, still... Johns double-checks shadows, probing with the muzzle of h shotgun. Satisfied, Johns exits. Now BOOM UP to reveal... Riddick. Hidden in a sinus cavity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trailing the others, Fry pauses to change out the O2 on h breather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddick drops to the ground. His arms and hands are now p with shards of boneyard ivory -- fashionable little body Spotting a shadow on the combing, he draws closer. And se Alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johns doubles back to Fry. He takes a hit of scotch, offe some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably makes it worse. Dehydrates you even more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably right. They drink anyway. Moving out of the sun, Fry leans up ag the combing. It brings her within arm's length of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddick. He pulls a bone-shiv, freshly chiseled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, I woulda played road dog for these guys. You could've stayed back. Pro'bly should've -- because, you know, if we don't find water.... "We may not make it back."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, I wanted to get away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I noticed. Never seen a "captain" quite so ready to leave her ship. Just as Riddick eases his blade toward Fry's neck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better keep moving....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd Owens mean? 'Bout not touching the switch? Fry searches his eyes, wondering if she can trust him -- again she leans back on the combing. We can actually see now. They could too, if they would just TURN THE FUCK ARO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. You can tell me, Carolyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Promise me. Swear to me you won't --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see anybody else here? Just between you and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During the landing...when things were at their worst...Owens was at his best. He's the one who wouldn't let the pilot dump the passenger cabin. Johns blinks, stunned. "Are you shittin' me?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trying again, Riddick reaches out with his shiv -- and de slices off some of Fry's hair. A locket. A souvenir. That all he wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So now you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck. Guess I'm more glad to be here than I thought. Riddick watches them move off -- then looks at the scotch left behind. It's still got one good swallow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leaving the boneyard, the scouting party reaches a cleft hills. Ahead is a canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold up. He jumps onto a rock, puts the scope to an eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought he might be coolin' it in the boneyard -- could either double-back to the ship or slip in behind us. So I left the bottle out as bait. SCOPE POV: PANNING the boneyard. FINDING the bottle. It's still got that one swallow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But nah. Didn't bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSER on the bottle. Only we see that the scotch has bee emptied -- and replaced with sand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working under the shade of a tarp, Zeke digs a communal g Three wrapped corpses wait nearby. He keeps a sight-line The crash ship. Shazza waves. Zeke waves back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The scouting party transits a narrowing canyon. Lined wit bones, it makes us feel like we're in the belly of some b Fry squints at the ridgetops. More of those spires are vi on the canyon rims, looming like silent sentinels. "Wh they? Just mineral deposits?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain...captain.... The Chrislams have found what appears to be a small deser Leathery petals are spread wide, revealing a round string ARABIC DISCUSSION. Desert fruit? Is it edible?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, wait, wait.... Fry takes the "plant," pushes the "petals" back down over core. They all stare. It's a baseball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are not alone here, yes? They look ahead, wondering what awaits them. But Johns is looking back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never thought we were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH ANGLE: An old WEATHER COCK CREAKS in the wind. Fry, Johns, and the Chrislams enter FRAME far below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assalamoo ahlaykum! The GREETING ECHOES through the settlement, built from st shipping containers. Tattered sun-shades flap in the wind rusty bike lies on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assalamoo ahlaykum!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long gone. Whoever they were. They move around a building -- and pull up short. Before looms a moisture-recovery unit, a hulking machine in disr Old jugs litter the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water...water there was here....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allahu Akbar....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (translating)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "God is Great," yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm born-again. Fry manages a weary smile -- but soon her eyes revisit th abandoned buildings. "Who were these people? Why did t leave so much behind?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through a window, we see the Johns and the Chrislams craw over the moisture-recovery unit, assessing repairs. PULL include Fry inside the settlement, inspecting... Refectory table. Place settings out. Years of dust. Photos on the wall: Settlers working modest gardens. Play baseball. Posing with children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fry enters a dark room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights. No response to her command. She pats around for old-style switches. Nothing. Perceiving black-out blinds on a windo throws them open to reveal... A man standing right outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Don't go too far, huh? Fry nods. Johns smiles, leaves. Just as her heart settles SOMETHING CREAKS behind her. It's an orrery, a mechanical device that shows the motion planets around their suns. Solar powered, the orrery star turning, CREAKING. One planet seems always to have sunlig

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No darkness. No lights because no darkness....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fry reaches a porch. It looks out over the rear of the settlement and more unforgiving terrain. She starts back inside -- but something glints at the edge of her vision. turns back...parts clothes on a laundry line...and sees t source of the glint. Excited hits on her breather. Fry vaults off the porch -- and starts walking as if on m bearing. Soon she's running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allahu Akbar! Allahu Akbar! Johns and the Chrislams trade looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Allahu Akbar! Fry stops on a groomed runway, out of breath. The others up. They too marvel at... The skiff, a light-duty vehicle of hybrid technology -- p plane, part space craft. Its fabric wings are wind-torn - the hull looks intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on caviar being added to toast-points. A SCRABBLING SOUND stops Paris in mid-bite. He eases out rocker, moves to the rear edge of the ship and looks down A shadow ducking under him. Small rocks still trickle dow dirt rampart just climbed by...someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This now qualifies as the worst fun I've ever had. Stop it. No response.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: War-pick in hand, Paris eases to ground-level. He checks perimeter, looks inside the ship. Nobody. Is he being fuc with? Again? He hopes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey? Oh, Audrey....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Paris spins. The voice came from the cargo hold -- and no he expected.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blades of sunlight stream in through cracks in the hull. enters to find Shazza and Audrey cutting open containers, searching for usable goods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me that was you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, it was me. What'd I do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Assailing my fragile sense of security, that's what.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you goin' on about? She's been right here for the last.... They all see it: Sun-blades are momentarily blocked by so passing outside. Someone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a quiet probe)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeke? No answer. Audrey springs to the other side of hold, puts to a crack there. HULL-CRACK POV: Far away, Zeke finishes digging the grave starts toward the ship. Audrey whirls back, mouths a silent alarm: "RIDDICK!" Paris goes bloodless. Shazza grabs the war-pick out of hi frozen hands, moves catlike to the main doors and poises ready to strike. Audrey follows with the hunting boomeran All eyes watch as... The sun-blades, winking off and on, chart Riddick's appro We feel like we're inside a magician's sword box, watchin blades shave closer and closer to us. Suddenly he appears And Shazza swings hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Facing them is a TOTAL STRANGER -- burned, half naked, on still clutching the emergency-release lever of his cryo-l Shazza stopped one inch short of killing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought...my God, I thought I was the only one who.... He lurches toward Shazza, trying to embrace her -- and se and brain-bits BLAM-BLAMMING against her. His own. The st sinks bonelessly to the ground. FAST RACK to reveal Zeke background, pistol leveled. He reads Shazza's horrified f and understands what he's done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Lord....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was just somebody else. From the crash. He was just....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cripes galore, I thought it was him. The murderin' ratbag. I thought he was.... He rushes over to check the dead stranger. As he bends do FAST RACK AGAIN to reveal Riddick in the background. He s 20 paces off, still unseen by the others. His goggle eyes covet... Zeke's breather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fry exits the skiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No juice, looks like it's been laid up for years. But we might be able to adapt --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up. Outside, Johns has an ear cocked to the wind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Thought I heard something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like my pistola.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: START on the drag-sled carrying Corpse #4-- the stranger. Zeke reaches the grave. The sun-tarp has fallen on one si blocking the sight-line between ship and grave. Zeke star unload the body -- but sees something he didn't notice be There's some kind of opening at the bottom of the grave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what the bloody hell.... Zeke hops down into the grave. CAMERA MOVES to reveal Rid hidden among the spires. He's been waiting for a chance j like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zeke drops to all fours. Looks into the tunnel. There see be some kind of burrow beyond. BURROW POV: Staring back at Zeke. Zeke takes a handlight off his belt, shines it into the b It's the last thing he ever does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As MORE GUNSHOTS jar Paris, Audrey, Shazza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FURIOUS CLOSEUPS: Zeke fighting for his life. PISTOL BLAS Something slashing at him. Blood dancing on air.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shazza sprints across hard-pack, heading for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The grave. She slaps aside the tarp to find... Riddick. Bone-shiv in hand, he just stands on the other s the grave. Shazza looks down. And SCREAMS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PURSUES Riddick as he lopes through the spires, ru from the scene of the crime. He turns a blind corner -- a SOMETHING NEARLY BLOWS HIS HEAD OFF at close range. He hi ground. A boot steps on his neck, keeping him there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same crap, different planet, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sucking on their breathers, Fry and the Chrislams make it the ship. They find Johns beating Riddick like a chained

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...I don't play that...I don't play that so just try again. C'mon, Riddick, tell me a better lie....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ease up, ease up. JOHNS! Just tell me what.... She hauls him off -- only to have Shazza start punching R

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd you do with 'im? You bloody sick animal you, what'dja do with me Zeke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fry and Johns stand over the grave. It's a gory mess -- b sign of Zeke. Johns has Riddick's confiscated shiv.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He used that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir Shiv-a-lot. He likes to cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why isn't it all bloody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I assume he licked it clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddick is back in chains, face pulpy from the beating, l to SOTTO VOCE VOICES outside. Fry enters, looks at him ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where is he? Riddick turns away, revealing a broken goggle-lens. The e beneath is closed: For some reason, he won't look at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me about the sounds. You told them you heard something right before.... (no response)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't talk to me, Johns'll take another crack at it -- at your skull.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Mean the whispers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What whispers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ones tellin' me to go for the sweet spot -- just to the left of the spine, fourth lumbar down. The abdominal aorta. What a gusher. Had a cup on his belt, so I used it to catch a little run-off. Metallic taste to it, human blood. Coppery. But if you cut it with peppermint schnapps, that goes away. Course, that's more for winter. Summertime, I take mine straight. Fry stares. Riddick gets a black satisfaction from his ro Boogeyman: If fear is the only kind of respect he can get Riddick is going to grab some with both hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't we try the truth now? A head-shaking beat, then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you people are so scared of me -- an' most days, I'd take that as a compliment -- but it ain't me you gotta worry about now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me your eyes. Again he turns away. She strips the goggles off. He sits lids shut tight, anticipating the pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Show me, Riddick. Imagine a virgin undressing in front of someone for the f time. That's how Riddick opens his eyes, startling us: No irises, just huge black-pool pupils. And from deep within jewel-like eyeshine. His eyes are as beautiful and unsett those of a starved jaguar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did this? To yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slam doctor. Well, we called him "doctor."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Heard about it. Just never seen it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fairly fuckin' ironic, wouldn't you say? Slamlight's so dim that you go and get your eyeballs taken out and shined up -- then you wind up here. Three ass-kick suns. (replacing goggles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe I did do a few people. But not this one. No ma'am, not this time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then where is he? He's not in the hole. We looked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look deeper. He CLICKS HIS TONGUE at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chain looped over one shoulder, Fry heads back to the gra Johns, Imam, Shazza, and Audrey keep pace as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what happened -- he went off on the guy, buried him on the hill somewhere, and now he's trying to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just be sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am sure. Look, murders aside, Riddick belongs in the Asshole Hall of Fame. He loves the jaw-jackin', loves making you afraid, 'cuz that's all he has. And you're playing right into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're gonna find the body, Johns. Christ, you're a cop. Why am I tellin' you this? We gotta go down and find it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, don't ask me to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought you didn't believe his story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't. But that ground looked none too stable, and I don't want anyone --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're afraid, I'll go. He shoots Audrey a scowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody else is going down but me, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pulling her aside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Bein' ballsy with your life now doesn't change what came before -- it's just stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you think I'm doin' this to prove something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said it, not me. Let's just not let one bad call lead to another.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for the tip, Johns. "Now get outta my way."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chain hooked to her web belt, Fry drops into the grave. S peers into the burrow...looks back up at the halo of face her...then slithers out of sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Letting her eyes adjust, Fry pats around lightly. Quickly finds Zeke's handlight, tries it. Broken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the chain slithering through hands, playing out moves deeper underground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fry makes an uphill turn. Sees a spray of light ahead. Wo forward to reach...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another chamber, wide and just large enough to stand in. of daylight bore down into the room. More old bones litte floor. Fry moves into one shaft and looks up at... An earthen funnel. The inside of a spire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're hollow.... CLICK-CLICK. Fry slow-turns toward the sound. CLICK-CLICK-CLICK. There's something here, something just beyond the cusp of Something unfolding. An icy hand grips her heart. Soundlessly, Fry backtracks chain, but... Something shadows across the exit. It stops her cold. Her hand finds something new. She angles it to the light. one of Zeke's boots -- with a bit of Zeke still in it. CLICKITY-CLICKITY-CLICKITY.... The whole chamber is coming alive around her, shadows unf skulking the perimeter, circling. Something impales the boot out of her hand, reclaiming it was faster than a lightning-strike. A paralyzed beat before... Fry makes her move, rolling back into the shaft of daylig springing straight up into...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spire. Bracing against the walls, Fry tries to "walk" way up -- but her chain goes taut. Did it catch on someth Or did something catch it? Fry starts pounding the earthe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here! I'm in HERE, HERE, HERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear.... They drop down and suspend their heads over the bloody gr listening. Nothing now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm over here in the -- Something tugs on her chain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, God.... CLOSE on her feet. Kicking hard at the walls, trying to g out footholds. A stronger tug. Fry loses altitude, slipping closer to... The MADLY CLICKING LAIR below. She tries to jettison her belt -- but can't brace herself undo the belt. Suddenly... Something explodes near her head. Daylight appears, follo faces, human faces. They're breaking through the spire wi pick-ax. Hands reach inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and birth her into daylight. Overlapping:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We got you...it's okay, it's okay...we got you now....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The child heard you before any of us could even....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you find him? You find Zeke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (half insane)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...wasn't Riddick...it was...it was... goddamn, that was stupid....but wasn't Riddick. Somethin' else down there that got Zeke and nearly got -- Her. She flies back into the spire. Something's still got chain. The others grab at flailing limbs. It's a tug-of-war now, hands on one end, unseen "hands" on the other -- and the are losing. Until... Imam unsheathes his blade... And slices through Fry's belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the chain falls down the spire. Without Fry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FAST SHOTS: Survivors packing up O2, liquor, umbrellas, t Koran -- whatever qualifies as "essential" on this planet the activity, Audrey pauses to look at... The spired hills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fry and Imam pull a power cell from the ship's battery ba THUMPING it down on the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One is all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At his personal locker, Johns digs out a box of shotgun s He bypasses the blue-metal shells for a red-metal one. Th something special about it -- though what, we can't be su

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A shadow falls over Riddick. He doesn't look up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Found somethin' worse than me, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're movin'. And I'm just wondering if I shouldn't lighten the load right now. Now their eyes meet. Johns RATCHETS HIS SHOTGUN and point at Riddick's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woof, woof. The SHOTGUN EXPLODES. CAMERA PANS off of Johns to show Riddick still alive. The shotgun discharged next to his h blew off his wrist chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want you to remember this moment, Riddick. The way it coulda gone and didn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deaf)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say that again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the deal. You work without the chains, without the bit -- without the shivs. You help us get off this rock....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what? The honor of goin' back to some asshole of a cell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truth is, Riddick, I'm tired of this head-up shit. I wanna be free of you as much as you wanna be free of me. A beat. The future rearranges in Riddick's head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd cut me loose, Boss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only if we both get outta this alive. And there may be a way. He offers a hand to help Riddick up, to seal the deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (staring at hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My recommendation: Do me. Don't take the chance that I'll get shiv-happy on your wannabe ass. Ghost me, Riddick. Would if I were you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you were me, I'd kill us both. C'mon, you wanna sit at the grown-up table or not? A beat. Riddick reaches out for the hand -- and grabs the shotgun with his off-hand. A blur of movement. Suddenly J is staring at the eyes of his own shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want you to remember this moment. He pumps shotgun, spitting blue shells over Johns. He dro emptied gun and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: EXTREMELY WIDE: Blue sun setting, yellow and red sun risi The survivors trek for the settlement. Fry and Imam lug t power cell between them, but the real load is shouldered Riddick. Promoted from murderous monster to beast of burd he tows a drag-sled heavy with cargo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Johns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So just like that. Wave your little wand and he's one of us now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't say that. But least this way I don't have to worry about falling asleep and not wakin' up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I feel we owe Mr. Riddick amends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right. Let's all line up and beg his forgiveness. Right you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least give the man some oxygen....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's happy just bein' vertical. Leave him be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I can talk to him now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in unison)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Paris drops a wine bottle. Trailing, Riddick collects it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paris P. Ogilvie. Antiquities dealer, entrepreneur.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking hands)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Richard B. Riddick. Escaped convict, murderer. Instead of returning the bottle, Riddick opens it and dri Paris hurries to catch up to the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, if I owned Hell and this planet...I believe I'd rent this out and live in Hell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FRY'S POV: Of spires high above us. The group falls silent as they transit the canyon, all ey the spires. Fry stops short, hearing... CLICKITY-CLICK. Neck hairs rise -- but soon the sound vanishes. The group moving again, faster. CLICKITY-CLICKITY-CLICK. Are they being stalked? Nervously, Fry traces the sound b to... Beads dangling from the belt of Pilgrim #1. Whenever he m the STRINGS CLACK together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, usually I can appreciate antiques, but, uh.... The survivors have reached the settlement. Fry is trying the power cell aboard the skiff as the others walk its ex

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little ratty-ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing we can't repair -- so long as the electrical adapts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a star-jumper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't need to be. Use this to get back up to the Sol-Track Shipping Lanes, stick out a thumb. You'll get picked up. (to Fry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right? Fry looks from Riddick to Johns. <i>"How did he know that

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little help here? They muscle the power cell aboard. Riddick starts to foll Johns blocks. He doesn't want Riddick inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check those containers for me. See what we can patch wings with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With religious fervor, the Chrislams are repairing the mo recovery unit -- the machine Allah led them to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: START on the battery bay. Hands are adapting the power ce the skiffs older electrical system. Soon... Lights wink on throughout the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that should buy us a sys-check. But we'll need more cells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 15 6-gigs here...90 gigs total...other ship carries 20-gig cells, so...five. Five total to launch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 25 kilos each, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old sand-cat outside. See if I can't get it up and chuggin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do it. And if you need an extra hand, tap our problem child out.... (looking out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Riddick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's walking the ghost town, finding dead gardens...upend chairs and furniture...broken skylights. Behind his back. Audrey and Pilgrim #3 (the youngest Chrislam) scurry thro FRAME, stalking this curious monster in their midst.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the other Chrislams, faces charged with anticipa while awaiting... The first drop of water. It appears at the bottom of a pi Tongues fight for it. Another drop forms in its place. No another and another. It brings CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Paris' hands. Getting ready to celebrate, he unw crystal goblets...dusts off the refectory table...and reh old Christmas garland. INTERCUT WITH...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hands digging in dirt. Covertly, Audrey and Pilgrim #3 watch Riddick digging nea entrance of a tall windowless structure. He excavates a pair of broken eyeglasses... a shattered l and a child's tin robot, timeless. Riddick thumbs a solar clean. The robot's language program warbles to life:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "...to all intruders. I am the guardian of this land. I will protect my masters at all cost. Death to all intruders..." Riddick stands and tries the doors. Locked. He peers thro small filthy window. Is there something moving inside? No now. Riddick removes some windblown trash from a doorside "Coring Room."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missin' the party. C'mon. It's Johns, keeping him on a short leash. Leaving, Riddic a trash bin. Hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Missin' the party. C'mon. He leaves. HOLD on the trash bin a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talkin' to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PILGRIM'S POV: Of Audrey exiting the trash bin and runnin Riddick and Johns. Pilgrim #3 is at the window of the coring room. He's foun inside. By the window's feeble light, he starts exploring visible at the center of this room is a vertical coring d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and for this, our gift of drink, we give thanks in the name of our Prophet, Muhammad, peace be upon him, and to our Lord, Jesus Christ of Nazareth, and to his father, Allah the Compassionate and the Merciful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The strangest religion.... Pilgrims finish pouring cloudy water into goblets. Riddic the last of it -- the part with sediment. SELECTED CLOSEU they drink. Nothing ever tasted finer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps we should toast our hosts. Who were these people, anyway? Miners?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like geologists. Advance team, moves around from rock to rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musta crapped out here, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But why did they leave their ship? Silence. It's a question no one has chosen to deal with y Imam notices one water glass unspoken for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the "Coring Room" sign. An attached solar panel moving, orienting toward sunlight. When it catches the fu brunt of the suns' rays... STORM SHUTTERS unlatch on the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pilgrim #3 hears SHOOTING LATCHES overhead. That sound br another sound: A strange SKITTERING. The pilgrim looks up there something in the rafters?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering Audrey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, just a skiff. Disposable, really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like an emergency life-raft, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure. Coulda had a real drop-ship take them off-planet. Long gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A toast to their ghosts, then.... Goblets rise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't leave, these people. Whatever got Zeke got them. They're all dead. It's like he just pissed in the punchbowl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you don't really think they left with their clothes on the lines? Photos on the walls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe they had weight limits, you don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you don't uncrate your emergency ship unless there's a fucking emergency.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rag it, Riddick. Nobody wants your theories on --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Riddick)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what happened? Where are they, then? Fry is the only one willing to look at reality -- or at l glance its way. At the window, Imam scans outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anyone seen the young one? Ali?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fry and Imam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Has anyone checked the coring room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now the storm shutters start yawning open, spreading dayl over Pilgrim #3 and... The ceiling rafters. They're encrusted with thick nests o something. The SKITTERING grows louder, more agitated. Sensing trouble, Pilgrim #3 hurries for a sliver of dayli a wall -- the breach he entered through. He never gets th Sunlight hits the first nest. It EXPLODES WITH LIFE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Imam hears the SCREAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHAOTIC SHOTS: More NESTS EXPLODE into individual creatur winged hatchlings moving like bats in a fire, talons hack slashing. His exit blocked, Pilgrim #3 veers into... A dark supply room. He slams the door, MUMBLES A BLESSING waits for the storm to pass. He's been cut -- but at leas still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the survivors run for the coring room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Riddick stays behind to drink their water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HINGES ARE BLASTED AWAY. The door caves in. Imam shoulder past Johns to enter and find... The empty coring room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ali? A NOISE from the supply room. Is it Ali? Just too scared come out? Imam opens the door... And hatchlings pour out. Moving with a gang-intelligence, they circle the room in soar high into the rafters -- then plunge into the coring SQUEALS VANISHING to infinity. Shocked silence, then... Pilgrim #3 tumbles to the ground. He's been shredded into kite-tails. There was a nest inside the supply room. Imam falls on him in grief. Johns and Fry inch forward to down... The coring shaft. It's littered with human bones. The ske of the settlers. Scattered about and picked clean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Against a blue sunrise, the Chrislams hold a prayer servi Paris and Audrey attend. Riddick watches from afar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why was the door chained up? Why the bloody hell would they lock themselves in like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sure, but tell you what: Chrislams better not be diggin' another grave out there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Other buildings weren't secure... They turn. Riddick enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...so they ran here. Heaviest doors. Thought they'd be safe inside, but... (looks down shaft)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone forget to lock the back door. Shazza joins him at the shaft. Gazing on the human remain

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So that's what come of me Zeke. An' you saw it. You was right there. Riddick nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were tryin' to kill him too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugging, "not necessarily")

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wanted his O-2. (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though I notice he tried to ghost my ass. When he shot up that stranger instead. Shazza can't deny it. She looks at him differently now, t she once beat while in chains. She takes off her breather

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suspicious)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, it's broken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Startin' to acclimate, anyhow. Take it. Riddick accepts it awkwardly, sucks down some pure O2. Jo watches the exchange closely, not much liking the idea of being promoted to oxygen-breathing human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's board this up and get the hell gone. They seem to stick to the dark, so if we stick to daylight, should be all --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 60 years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha'? Coring samples line the room, laid out on counters. Fry's scrutinizing them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Core-samples are dated. Last one is 60 years ago. This month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah? What's special about that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dunno. Maybe nothing, but.... But now Fry remembers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The orrery. The year-counter clicks over to "45" as... Fry opens the drive box and starts turning the main gear, accelerating the orbits. CLOSE on the counter. "56...57...58...59...60." They all see it: A giant ringed world eclipses the suns a plunges their planet into darkness. Persistent darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fuckin' kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not afraid of the dark, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crossing the yard in wide strides:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...need those cells from the crash ship. Shit, still gotta check out the hull, patch the wings --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's wait on the power cells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait for what? Until it's so dark we can't even find our way back to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not sure when it happens, so let's not --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fucking cells over here, Johns. What's the discussion? A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever tell you how Riddick escaped?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alone inside the skiff, Johns and Fry continue with more

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (jarred)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can pilot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hijacked a prison transport, made a helluva good run 'fore I tracked him down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with faint hope)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, maybe that's a good thing. Maybe I can use him to help with --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He also figured out how to kill the pilot, Fry. A mental shiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said we were going to trust him now. You said there was a deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I said. He challenges her to read his mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is a dangerous game you're playing, Johns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May've noticed chains don't work on this guy. Only way we're truly safe is if he believes he's goin' free. But if he stops believin' --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, if he learns that you're gonna royally fuck him over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- we need a fail-safe. Bring the cells over at the last possible minute -- when the wings are ready, when we know we're ready to launch. Fry looks at him with new eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, he hasn't harmed any of us. Far as I can tell, he hasn't even lied to us. Just stick to the deal, Johns. Let him go if that's what it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a murderer. The law says he's gotta do his bid. Shaking her head, she looks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dancin' on razor blades here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I won't give him a chance to grab another ship -- or to slash another pilot's throat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johns descends the gangway -- and finds Riddick erecting table in the shade of the skiff. He seems out of earshot. anyway. As they trade looks, another flu-like shiver runs through Johns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad sign. Shakin' like that in this heat. Johns moves on. The Chrislams appear, shouldering a roll Vectran (wing-fabric material). They drop it on the table Ready to cut bindings, Imam pats his hip for the knife th just there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking after Johns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll cut. He has the knife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Shazza and Audrey repair the sand-cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on the knife slicing through the Vectran. Riddick hands the trim to Pilgrim #1. CAMERA FOLLOWS as h scampers onto the skiff...balance-beams over wing-struts. delivers the piece to Imam, who stitches the fabric like Berber rug-weaver. Pilgrim #1 pauses to check on... The setting blue sun. Nothing unusual. Yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hatch closes, seals. CLOSE on a monitor. A "HULL INTEGRITY TEST" is underway. scans rising pressure gauges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like we're a few shy.... Fry whirls. Riddick is aboard, staring at the depleted ba bay. And he has Imam's blade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Power cells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange, not doin' a run-up on the main drive yet. (half-beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strange unless he told you the particulars of my escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got the quick-and-ugly version.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An' now you're worried about a repeat of history?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Entered our minds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I asked what you thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You scare me, Riddick. That's what you wanna hear, isn't it? There, I admit it, Can I get back to work now? She finds the courage to turn her back on him. Riddick mo closer -- and takes a beat to scan the controls. The cabi pressure builds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think Johns is an do-right man? You think I can trust him to cut me loose? A beat. Does Riddick already know? Is he testing her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why, what'd you hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, guess if it was trickeration he'd just do me, huh? Then again...I am worth twice as much alive. (reading her face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't know? Johns ain't a cop. Oh, he's got that shiny badge an' all, but nah -- he's just a merc and I'm just a payday. That's why he won't kill me. The creed is greed. It knocks her off stride, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save it, Riddick. We aren't gonna turn on each other -- no matter how hard you try. Riddick moves right up behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't truly know what's gonna happen when the lights go out, Carolyn -- but I do know that once the dyin' starts, this little psycho family of ours is gonna rip itself apart. So you better find out the truth. Come nightfall, you better know exactly who's standing behind you. A monitor chirps the news: "HULL INTEGRITY --100%." EXHAL GASSES, the hatch opens automatically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, ask him 'bout those shakes. And ask why your crew-pal had to scream like that 'fore he died.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSEUPS: Hands select a red-metal shotgun shell from a b pull the shell open...remove a glass ampule hidden inside the ampule into a injection syringe. The syringe touches eager arm vein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you? Really? Shirt off, Johns looks up. She's in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not a real cop, are you? Just some mercenary who goes around talkin' about the law like --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never said I was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never said you were a hype, either. She moves closer. Rummages through his stuff brazenly. Fi shitload of red shells with the hidden ampules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a little caffeine in the morning, I have a little morphine. So what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here you got two mornings every day. Wow, were you born lucky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a problem unless you're gonna make --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lashing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You made it a problem when you let Owens die like that. When you had enough drugs to knock out a fucking mule-team.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Owens was already dead. His brain just hadn't caught on to that fact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything else we should know about you, Johns? Christ, here I am lettin' you play games with our lives when -- He catches her hands -- and moves them around his body, f her into an embrace. We understand why when we see a CLOS of her hands: They find a jagged purple scar beside his s

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My first run-in with Riddick. Went for the sweet-spot and missed. They had to leave a piece of the shiv in there. I can feel it, sometimes, pressing against the cord. (giving her hands back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So maybe the care and feeding of my nerve-endings is my business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You coulda helped. And you didn't. O.S., we hear the Chrislams JABBERING ARABIC and calling "Captain, Captain...."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, look to thine own ass first. Right, "captain"? It cuts deep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fry and Johns move outside. The others have gathered, all gang-locked on... An arch in the sky. Luminous, ominous, it grows from the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do my eyes see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's starting.... They watch hypnotically as the arch rises, inching toward suns. Shazza shakes out of the trance first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we need anything from the crash ship -- I suggest we kick on. That sand-cat's solar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MULTIPLE SHOTS: Shazza cranking the sand-cat...hands snat up lights, water, ropes...Chrislams piling aboard the san

dialogues.speaker: LET'S GET THOSE CELLS
dialogues.text: Sand-cat moving...Riddick jumping onto the rear bed....Pa Audrey running, catching up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We stay together! C'mon!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johns doubles back, grabs his shotgun shells, swings out door...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and catches up to the sand-cat. Riddick reels him aboa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't wanna miss this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lookit. Lookit! They turn back to see the rim of a giant planet. It's cre over the horizon. The luminous arch is the planet's rings

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sand-cat storms through the canyon. As it passes thro massive ribcage... The ROLL CAGE SMASHES OUT some low-bridge bones.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sand-cat reaches the crash ship. Bodies leap off. Par steals a look at... The rising planet. It threatens to blot out suns, sky, un

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johns yanks the first power cell and starts dragging it o deck. Riddick yanks a second cell and, carrying it on his shoulder, passes Johns with a suck-my-ass grin. Johns sho his cell and stumbles after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shazza wheels the sand-cat around, getting clearance betw and the ship. The Chrislams lash a scrap-metal sled to the sand-cat. Riddick drops the first cell onto the sled, Johns the sec They're racing the eclipse and each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the rings of the planet eclipse the yellow sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like God just closed a blind: Daylight dims. The cha light brings a GROWING HIGH-PITCHED SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't stop, don't stop.... But Paris can't help himself. He squints to see...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spires. THE SOUND seems to come from there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the rings eclipse the red sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A second darkness sweeps over the survivors. Now they all beholding...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something pouring from the spire-tops. Backlit by coronal it first seems to be smoke or ash -- but soon we realize are living things, HATCHLINGS SQUEALING IN DELIGHT over t first nightfall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, how many can there.... They keep coming, filling the sky with thick waves. Merci the hatchlings seem to be moving away. But now one wave c from another -- and does a quick about-face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a suggestion, but perhaps we should flee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
