dialogues.text: Cargo hold, everyone in the cargo hold. lesgo, lesgo, lesgo. They run. Reach the cargo hold. Turn back to see... Riddick and Shazza still coming. Hearing the SQUEALING WA descending on them... Riddick and Shazza hit to the dirt. Hatchlings torrent ju inches overhead. CLOSE on Shazza. Horrified. Hard to breathe. Like being underwater. CLOSE on Riddick. He watches in awe, no more frightened t kid lying on his back looking up at the stars. Experiment eases a bone-shiv into the hatchlings. Instantly it's whi down to nothing. It's like a river of razor blades. The hatchling keep coming. Shazza whips a panicky look at cargo hold. Can she make it? Should she even try?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell her to stay there. Stay down.

dialogues.speaker: SHAZZA, JUST STAY DOWN
dialogues.text: Shazza starts worming toward the cargo hold. Suddenly the hatchings vanish. A beat. Is it safe? Shazza gets to her feet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, NO, NO, NO.... ...and the wave is back, enveloping Shazza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Standing in the mouth of the cargo container, the others last glimpse of Shazza as she flies by the doors, caught the funnel-cloud of hatchlings. Then she's simply gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Still on the ground, Riddick checks left and right like s about to cross a busy street. Now he gets up, smacks his clean, strolls for the hold. Behind him... A rising GANG-CLICKING. CLOSE on Fry. She knows the sound better than anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The spires are crumbling, torn down from within.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reaching the cargo hold, Riddick turns around for one las PUSH IN as he sheds goggles -- and looks at the world wit jaguar eyes. RIDDICK'S POV: In degraded image, we see the predators -- hatchlings -- emerge from the spires. They're large, mamm hammer-headed. They CLICK with echo-location, sounding ou world they haven't inhabited in 60 years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it? What's happening? RIDDICK'S POV: The predators launch from the hills, glidi SOUNDING, searching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like I said. Ain't me you gotta worry about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rim of the planet overtakes both suns. The world goes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Vault-like DOORS BOOM CLOSED. The survivors are locked inside the only secure part of t Somehow they've been reduced to neanderthals huddling in cave, listening to the howls of the sabertooths.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if...what if she's still out there... still alive....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't want to jump to conclusions here...but 'member that boneyard? These just might be the fuckers that killed every other living thing on this planet, okay? Chances of Shazza knockin' on that door anytime soon are just about zero squared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agreeing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the cut-marks on the bones. Wasn't a natural die-off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet, please. Everyone. Imam is listening at the cargo door. The others pile up alongside, ears tuned like radar. CLICKING SWEEPS PAST ou

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do they do that? Make that sound?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Perhaps the way they see. With sound, reflecting back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (realizing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Echo-location. That's what it is.... Now MORE CLICKING -- behind them. Lights whip around to f Nothing. Only the door of an open container about halfway the tunnel-like hold. A volley of looks. <i>"How the fuck could one get in here

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breach in the hull. I dunno. More CLICKING. Johns realizes they expect him to check it

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather piss glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, you got the big gauge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna rag your fat mouth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe it's just their beads again. Imam, are you still --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, no, I do not believe --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, man, you're drivin' everybody bugfuck with those things. Why don't you just lose the goddamn.... More CLICKING -- along with the sound of TOPPLING CARGO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big beads. Butching up, Johns sucks on his breather and shimmies tow The open container. Leading with his shotgun, he FIRES bl around the door. Something SQUEALS -- then silence. Johns his head and a light around the door to spot... Hatchlings on the ground, blasted into dog food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. We're okay. Just some small ones that musta -- Something WHOOSHES for his head, swinging like a scythe. catches his shotgun, DISCHARGING IT, giving us... A flash-image of an adult predator. Up close. In one thin second, Johns is back with the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very big beads.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not staying in here another.... He goes for the main-door lever, ready to flee into the n Fry lunges for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Christ, you don't know what's out there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what's in here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody come, this way and we should be safe. Hurry, please....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imam shepherds them into a container. The door slams clos At first, only the sound of MOUTHS SUCKING BREATHERS. The SCRATCHING. Johns fumbles with a cutting torch. Gets it burning. Adju the gasses to illuminate... The door. Scythe-like blades are probing joints. Suddenly BLOWS drive everyone back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Johns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you do sumpin' else with that? 'Sides holding it in my fucking face? Taking the hint, Johns starts cutting the common wall bet containers. It's a race between the sparks of his cutter blades of the predators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An burn-outline appears in the common wall. Johns kicks o escape hatch. Audrey speed-crawls through first as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Predators shred into the container right behind them, CLI sweeping, hunting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SERIES OF SHOTS: Again and again, they burn a new escape just as the predators break into the container being vaca always entering darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside their fifth container now, Johns torches away. Fry Paris use cargo to block the entrance hole -- then block cargo with their bodies. Riddick adds his weight -- until he notices pepper-shot i cargo. Suspecting the worst, he leaves the others behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, hello? ...and moves to the front of the container where darkness prevails. Something SQUISHES underfoot. He slips off gogg RIDDICK'S POV: Of dead hatchlings on the floor. This is t open container, the one where Johns found predators. Sensing energy, Riddick lifts his face. RIDDICK'S POV: Of an adolescent predator. It squats atop eating a hatchling. A heavy bone-blade crowns its skull. Sensing Riddick, it sweeps the area with INQUISITIVE CLIC PREDATOR POV: Of Riddick. (NOTE: The PREDATOR POV is a crude image that gives impre without detail. We're "seeing" what the predator hears wi echo-location. Think of a sonagram that strobes and wraps subject in 3-D space.) Oblivious, the others kick out the new escape hatch. Audr Fry, and Johns worm through. Imam and Pilgrim #2 hang bac "Where's Riddick?" He's in a stare-down with a predator. Searching, Pilgrim #2 rounds a corner -- and finds his he caught in a vice-like grip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't. Move. RIDDICK'S POV: As a second predator appears above them. T one reaches down with its scythe blade... And gently probes the two men. It wants know what they're of. CLOSE on the pilgrim's shoes. Over-running with piss. More blades descend, moving over them like surgical instr One test-slices Riddick's shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the next container, Fry waits anxiously. Hissing throu escape hatch:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imam? Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a predator's scythe blade. It test-slices the pi skin. Blood wells up. All CLICKING CEASES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hasan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddick? TIGHT on the pilgrim -- more scared now that the clicking stopped. Losing his nerve, he bolts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.... The predators are on him, just blurs in the dark. DEATH-S RIDDICK'S POV: A third predator appears above him. Making his move, Riddick darts around cargo and heads for escape hatch as... Fry's light catches him square in the face. Blinded, Ridd HOWLS and stumbles forward. Fry's light leaps deeper to h The predator right behind him. With a similar reaction, t beast HOWLS and flails back. HOLD on Fry for a time-stopped moment. What stopped it? W really her? Suddenly a SHOTGUN EXPLODES beside her head. up, Johns is BLASTING shadows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop it, stop it, STOP IT!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Sokay, 'sokay. I killed it. They give him a look. "Sure you did." Suddenly a C to the floor, sending everyone jumping back in a perfect pattern. "Christ, he did kill one." Fry reclaims her dropped light and beams it on the carcas Wherever the light strikes it, the flesh chars and steams

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like the light is scalding it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hurts them. Light actually hurts them.... VULTURE SOUNDS from the two O.S. adolescents, fighting ov scraps of the pilgrim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that...Hasan? Riddick nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll burn a candle for him later. C'mon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cargo has been shoved against the door and walls. The sur gather around Fry's handlight. Audrey -- tough little Aud has been reduced to a shivering lump of mush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...one cutting torch...one handlight here, two more in the cabin...I think two more....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spirits. Anything over 45 proof burns well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many bottles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not sure. Ten?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those umbrellas, the ones that mist. Would they burn? (reading his face)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you got a receipt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Possibly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awright. So maybe we'll have enough light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough for what? Now she challenges him to be the mind-reader.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, lady. If you're in your right mind, I pray you go insane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to others)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can stick to the plan. If we get four cells back to the skiff, we're off this rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate to kill a beautiful theory with an ugly fact, but that sand-cat won't run at night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll have to carry the cells...drag them...whatever it takes. Troubled faces. Is it just our imagination? Or is the lig the floor growing dimmer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean...tonight? With all those things still out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure. Why not? Sounds like a hoot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back it up. How long can this last? Few minutes? Couple hours? No one knows for sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had the impression...from the model... that the two planets were moving as one. That there would be...a lasting darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those suns gotta come back sometime. And if these animals really are phobic about light, we just sit tight till then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure that's what someone else said. Locked inside that coring room. A persuasive thought. Eyes swing back to Audrey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, we gotta think about everyone now -- the kid especially. How scared is she gonna be out there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, don't use her like that, for a smoke screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smoke screen for what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For your own fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes narrowing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Why don't you rag your hole for two seconds and let someone else come up with a plan that doesn't involve MASS SUICIDE? Two seconds pass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much you weigh, Johns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's it matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 79 kilos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you're 79 kilos of gutless white meat, and that's why you can't come up with a better plan. He makes a move for her. Riddick blocks. Johns' shotgun b the underside of Riddick's chin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about that reward, Johns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm willing to take a cut in pay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How 'bout a cut in your gut? Johns looks down. CAMERA DROPS to reveal the shiv Riddick poised for evisceration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Trash Baby, you're gonna regret this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...this solves nothing...please.... Johns backs off first. The light grows dimmer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Audrey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're afraid of our light. That means we don't have to be so afraid of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're certain you can find the way back? Even in the dark?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm not. But he can. She's pointing, of course, to Riddick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eclipsing planet dominates half the sky. In whatever light remains, we see clouds forming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cargo doors crack open. Mixed for maximum flame, the cutt pushed outside and swept around. Fry appears behind it. Moving like hostages, the survivors cross open ground, tr to heed the PRIMAL SOUNDS beyond their light. Soon they r The main cabin. Blackness inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddick. He lifts his goggles. RIDDICK'S POV: Checking the cabin. Finding a lot of wreck but no life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks clear. Johns shoulders ahead and crawls in first. Just as he sta inside... A PREDATOR BUZZSAWS over his head, fleeing the cabin, tak into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck me. You said "clear."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Said "looks clear."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what's it look like now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rechecking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks clear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get the goddamn lights on.... They scramble aboard. Riddick TONGUE-CLICKS behind Johns. He isn't amused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PREP MONTAGE: We see the survivors powering up cabin ligh yanking three more cells from the battery bay...threading cord through Paris' misting umbrellas, filling the reserv with high-octane liquor...swapping out O2 canisters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Reloading his shotgun, Johns finds himself shaking again. unpockets a shell -- a red morphine shell -- and gives it lover's look. Behind him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready, Johns. He palms the shell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'll lead you over the first cliff. You know that, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just burnin' light here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You give him the cells and the ship -- and he will leave you. He will leave you all out there to die.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't get it, Johns. What is so goddamn valuable in your life that you're worried about losing? Huh? Is there anything at all? Besides your next hype? (no response)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got no right to be so scared. Neither one of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As hands yank the last power cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cabin lights die. Still brooding, Johns finishes loading shotgun in the dark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a burning wick. Alcohol mist shoots across the f create... A FIREBALL. Two umbrella torches, fabric already burned a BELCH FIREBALLS into the night. By this light and more, w Imam chained into the first harness of the drag-sled. Bes him, Johns fumbles with a second harness. Hands help him the chains. The hands belong to... Riddick. Both men recognize the irony of the prisoner hel his captor into chains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to all)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep the light going. That's all we have to do to live through this. Just keep your light burning. Riddick loops a handlight over his neck, places it to shi down his back. A beacon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Fry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be runnin' about 10 paces ahead. I want light on my back -- but not in my eyes. And check your cuts. These things know our blood now. CLOSE on Audrey. Overhearing, she goes stone-faced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddick...was thinkin' we should make some kind of deal. Just in case, you know, this actually --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Had it with deals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I just wanted to say --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody's gonna turn a murderer loose. I fuckin' knew better. It worries Fry. <i>"If he doesn't expect to go free...."<

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been a long time since anyone's trusted me. That's somethin' right there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can, can't we? Trust you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually... (completely genuine)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I been askin' myself. He walks away. HOLD on Fry -- wondering if she hasn't mad terrible, terrible mistake.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: The drag-sled begins moving. SERIES OF TRACKING SHOTS: Riddick running point, goggles eyes flashing. Johns and Imam pulling the drag-sled like malamutes, handlights sweeping. Pilgrims #1 at the first guard position, Fry and Audrey at the second, each positi carrying an umbrella torch, FIREBALLS BLAZING. Paris stum along at rear-point, sweeping the cutter back and forth, shadow a threat. They are a train of light. CLOSE on the sled. Holding four power cells and eight bot of booze. CLOSE on Fry. Looking down. Noting sand-cat tracks underf

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Below us run the survivors. CRANE UP AND AWAY so that the lights become insignificant...so that we include, in FORE the silhouettes of gliding predators. They're following f above, awaiting their chance.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: FRY'S POV: Of the ground. The sand-cat tracks have vanish

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you noticed too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddick. Riddick. The procession grinds to a halt. Everyone sucks hard on breathers as they muster inside the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the sand-cat tracks? Why aren't we still following them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saw something I didn't like.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such as.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hard to tell, sometimes...even for me... but looked like a bunch of those big boys chewin' each other's gonads off. Thought we'd swing wide. Okay by you? Paris looks over his shoulder. <i>"We went around what?"< CLICKING breaks up the confrontation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's move. (to Audrey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a detour. He'll get us there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we switch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, switch what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I twisted my ankle running backwards like that. And I'm not sure I can.... (off their stares)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, that's a lie. I just don't want to be alone back there anymore. If you could just give me a few minutes up front here --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the pilot, she should stay close to the cells.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, so I'm disposable?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll switch, I'll switch! Christ, just get this train moving!

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: They trundle on, Fry the new tail-gunner. At side guard, Paris relaxes a bit -- even though the CLI never seems far from earshot. A weak FIREBALL SPEWS from torch. He checks the reservoir. Almost empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light, please, need light here.... Still moving, Johns and Imam train lights on Paris while refuels. For a brief moment, Audrey strays from the light PREDATOR'S POV: Dive-bombing the girl. A HIGH-VELOCITY CLICKING: It's like an incoming missile. lunges at the last nanosecond... And flattens Audrey to the ground. Scythe blades swing... CHINKING the harness-chains on Imam's back. Johns whirls, BLASTS. Light-beams leap around. But the pr is long gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trembling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...have we been cut? Can someone tell me if.... He finds his dropped light, thumbs the switch again and a Broken. In the confusion, Paris has been left in the dark. Someth slashes him from behind. It's like the night has claws.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sweet Jesus.... The bottle drops. The blood flows. The CLICKING STOPS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sweet Jesus, WILL YOU GET ME SOME

dialogues.speaker: LIGHT OVER HERE
dialogues.text: Faces whip around. But before their lights can rescue him Paris is gone, snatched away by a swooping blur. Light-beams jump fitfully, vainly. RIDDICK'S POV: Of predators feasting on Paris. Carrying a youngling on its back, a female predator arrives late and find a place at the trough. With shocking apathy, it whip youngling off its back and begins devouring it. Other pre start in-fighting, killing themselves for food. POV PANS pair of predators, closer, SOUNDING out new prey. POV PAN AGAIN to include the object of their desire. Audrey. CLOSE on Riddick. Trying to figure it out. CLOSE on Audrey. Listening to the HORRIFIC FEEDING SOUNDS Oblivious to all the attention she's getting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you see? Riddick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hunger. I see 60 years of hunger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As clouds mass.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Into a rising wind, the survivors range on. Audrey now carries Paris' torch, refueled and COUGHING FI at regular intervals. Fry seems to be handling rear-point well, until... The cutter sputters and dies. She ditches it and takes th from Audrey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bottle-count.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four fulls, one half. That mean we're halfway there? I hope? Good question. They've just been blindly following... The light on Riddick's back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we pick up the pace? Working like a mule, Johns growls to himself. "If you can do better...." Abruptly he slaps an arm across Im spotting... A sled-track. In front of them. Fry hears a SHOTGUN RATCHET. She spins to see... Johns out of his chains. Moving forward. Jamming the shot into the back of Riddick's neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We aren't completely stupid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay in the light! Everybody! Stay in the fucking --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We crossed our own tracks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's running us 'round in circles. Look for yourself. Look!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddick? What the hell are you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. Imagine a hundred Geiger-counters next to a truckload of plutonium. That's the SOUND that rides the wind now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Canyon ahead. I circled once to buy some time to think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About how to kill us and still get these cells to the skiff. Goddamnit, we're just doin' the heavy lifting for this prick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answering Fry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What it's gonna be like when we hit that canyon. With her bleeding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you jaw-jackin' about? Girl's not cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (agreeing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. She's not. It hits Fry like a two-by-four. She looks at Audrey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confessing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want you to leave me there... back at the ship...that's why I didn't say anything....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, we'd never....Oh, God, honey, you shoulda told me sooner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finally getting it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, this can't be happening to me....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They been nose-open for her ever since we left. They go off blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well...we must keep her close, then. Here, she'll be safe if we put her between --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scanning)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no "safe." An epic beat. The wind gusts...the FLAMES CHATTER...their fill with CANYON SOUNDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not gonna work. We gotta go back. Johns brays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you're the one who got me out here, turned me into a goddamn sled dog. An' now you 'spect me to go back like a whipped dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wrong. I admit it. My bad, okay? Now let's just go back to the ship.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. Nice breeze, wide open spaces -- you know, I'm startin' to enjoy myself out here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fucking high again? Just listen to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no, you're right, Fry. What's to be afraid of? My life is a steamin' pile of meaningless toadshit anyhow. So I say mush on! Canyon's only couple hundred meters, after that we're in Skiff City! So why don't you just butch up, stuff a cork in that kid, and get --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's the captain, we should listen to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to her? Her? When she was willing to sacrifice us all? A beat. Eyes turn to Fry. She wants to protest -- but can

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he talkin' about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: During the crash, she --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a warning growl)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This does not help us, Johns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- she tried to blow the whole fucking passenger cabin, tried to kill us --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just shut up, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- tried to kill us in our sleep. Paris had it right -- we are disposable. We're just walking ghosts to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you RAG YOUR STUPID HOLE! She rushes him, ready to rip his eyes out. He shunts her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not alive because of her -- we're alive in spite of her. He swung below the belt -- and connected. Fry's chin quak her knees fail. The undertow of events finally pulls her

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We cannot go through there....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (lording)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much you weigh right now, Fry? Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (pushing him back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, fine, you've made your point. We can all be so scared as you. Johns snatches a light away from Imam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to all)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Verdict's in. The light moves forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They trudge on, slower now, building reserves for the can At rear-point, Fry follows like a broken rudder. Pilgrim draws the sled with Imam. And up ahead...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Johns falls in step with Riddick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't all of us gonna make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just realized that, huh? CLICKING nearby. Johns BLASTS the night, driving the soun away -- and reminding everyone of who carries the Big Gau

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Six of us left. If we could get through that canyon and lose just one, that'd be quite a fucking feat, huh? A good thing, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not if I'm the one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if you're one of five? Riddick stares. "I'm listening."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're they doin' up there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talking about the canyon, I suppose. How to get us through. Overhearing, Fry looks. It's odd to see Johns and Riddick walking side by side, like equals. Like partners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, it's hellified stuff -- but no different than those battlefield doctors when they have to decide who lives and who dies. It's called "triage," okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kept calling it "murder" when I did it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either way, figure it's something you can grab onto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (doping it out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sacrifice play. Hack up one body, leave it at start of the canyon. Like a bucket of chum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Trawl with it. There's a cable on the sled. We can drag the body behind us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice embellishment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't wanna feed these land-sharks -- just keep 'em off our scent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So which one caught your eye?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don' look, don' look, don' look....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fry spots Riddick's look -- and Johns' non-look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imam. Slow down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't stop, just slow down.  Little more space 'tween us and them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would rather we all stay--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what I say. Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's her name, anyway?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you care? Riddick shrugs. "I don't."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then let's not name the Thanksgiving turkey, okay? I assume you still got a shiv.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you 'spect me to do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's one more to you? Like this is the one that sends you to Hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, you're a piece of art, Johns. They oughtta hang you in a museum somewhere. Or forget the museum -- maybe they should just hang you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Fry and the others keep slowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awright. You do the girl, I'll keep the others off your back. Riddick stops. Reconsiders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, don't tell me you're growin' scruples.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shakes head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just wonderin' if we don't need a bigger piece of chum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like who, Mr. Chrislam? EXTREMELY TIGHT on both men: In their eyes, we see the ne partnership splintering apart: "Like Mr. Johns." Riddick makes a play for the shotgun. It BLASTS skyward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the fight erupts:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring the light!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're they doing? What're we --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave the sled, let's go, go, go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIGHT SCENE: Johns' light hits the ground, creating an ar illumination. FAST CLICKING nearby. Still struggling, Rid and Johns somehow manage to gang-aim the shotgun and BLAS CLICKING AWAY. The shotgun goes free. Johns lunges for it, but Riddick k into the night. And then pulls his shiv.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta stay in the light, Johns. That's the only rule. Johns circles inside the light. Fucking with him, Riddick poking and jabbing, backing him up against the wail of da Johns stumbles over something. A bone. A club. Riddick finds his own bone-club, and now they go at it li cavemen. Riddick beats on Johns' club-hand, breaking fing forcing him to drop the bone. Just trying to get away now makes a desperate lunge for the light, but... Riddick shivs open his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember that moment? Gushing blood, Johns starts crawling pathetically with th Riddick dogs him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoulda never took the chains off, Johns. You were one brave fuck, before. Now look at you. Oh, yeah, you were Billy Bad-ass with your gauge...with your chains.... Johns finds the shotgun. <i>"And I'm still Billy Bad-ass. sweeps it around with the light, ready to kill... Blackness. Where'd Riddick go? CLICKING behind Johns. He whirls to see... Something big coming for him. Johns BLASTS IT back into t night, dropping the light as he does. Eyes in the back of head, he whirls again and takes aim on... Another bull-rushing predator. Johns triggers a bad round. Crazed, he ratchets and level shotgun for another try. He's too late. BIG CLOSEUP as the ejected shell rolls to a stop. It's re Johns loaded a morphine shell in the dark. RIDDICK'S POV: With Johns skewered by the armpits, the pr lifts him off the ground and "stares" with a deceptively CLICKING-COOING SOUND. PREDATOR'S POV: Of Johns' final expression. RIDDICK'S POV: The predator rears back its head -- then s forward, hitting Johns with the full force of its skull-b splitting him in two.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Fry, Imam, Audrey, Pilgrim #1. They're running, stumbling trying to backtrack the sled marks. Checking for pursuit, looks over her shoulder... And crashes into Riddick. He was just standing in the dar waiting for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to the ship, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of our way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So everybody huddles together till the lights burn out? Until you can't see what's eating you? That the big plan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Mr. Johns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which half?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean.... Conflicted, they all look back. Audrey starts to puddle u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gonna lose everybody out here....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He died fast. And if we got any choice, that's the way we should all go out. (to Audrey, softly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you cry for Johns. Don't you dare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLACK SCREEN. We hear the canyon in full cry now -- CLICK BATTLING BONE-BLADES...MATING CRIES...the RENDING OF FLES and SNAPPING OF TENDON. Far below, twin flames appear as survivors reach the gauntlet. Predators perch in FOREGROU just hulking silhouettes "watching" from a canyon rim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are but five: Fry, Riddick, Audrey, Imam, and Pilgri CLOSE on each face as they listen to the CANYON. There mu countless predators ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many you see?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One or two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three full bottles. But almost time to refill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't seem like enough to turn back on, does it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only see one way. Turn the sled over and drag it like that, girl down low. Light up everything we got -- and run through like dogs on fire. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (understanding)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sled as a shield....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what about the cells?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take those. She looks at him hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're just here to carry your light, aren't we? Just the torch-bearers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's drop back an' boot up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: START on the power cells. They're been lashed together in queue. Working amid the giant bones, Riddick crafts a new harnes the old straps. Close behind him, Imam is MUTTERING IN AR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blessing you like the others. (off his look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's painless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And pointless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see. Well, even if you don't believe in God, it doesn't mean He won't be --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't see. Riddick shrugs into the harness, snugs it down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Cuz you don't spend half your life in lock-down with a horse-bit in your mouth and not believe. And you surely don't start out in a liquor store trash bin with an umbilical cord wrapped around your neck and not believe. Oh, absolutely I believe in God. And I absolutely hate the fucker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He will be with us. Nonetheless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give my blessing to the girl. She needs a spare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The torches. Maxed out. Burning non-stop. Fry and Imam. Sled chains on. Lapping up O2. Each holding torch. Pilgrim #1. Clutching a handlight. Audrey. Rolling under her sled-shield, becoming the turtl metal carapace. Riddick. Goggles on. He has no desire to see what horrors surround them. There's just one path, anyway: Straight th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As fast as you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure you can keep --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As fast as you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SLEW OF SHOTS: Fry and Imam on the move, dragging the shi fast. Audrey speed-crawling beneath. Pilgrim #1 tripping behind the shield. And Riddick behind them all, face alre tortured, pulling 200 pounds of stubborn-mule cargo -- ye somehow keeping pace. The torch flames, stretched by the flank them in fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As predators launch from the rim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: First come the hatchlings, streaming right into their fac then veering away at the last second, repulsed by light. come FERAL SOUNDS overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look. Thin blue liquid spatters them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do not look up. More spattering. Fry looks up -- and stumbles when she be A ceiling of predators. At the cusp of light, they dive a weave and dart, slashing each other in a rabid desire to OUT the humans below. It's like looking into a bucket of eels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep going, keep going, keep going, keep going! His voice whips them like the Devil's coxswain. Chastened keeps her eyes down and speed up. More blue blood showers down -- followed by entrails drop out of the sky. Could this be Hell itself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a muttered mantra)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "So dark the clouds around my way I cannot see,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But through the darkness I believe God leadeth me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gladly place my hand in His when all is dim,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And, closing my weary eyes, lean hard on him...."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now WHOLE CORPSES ARE CRASHING DOWN around them, victims of in-fighting. Fry and Imam start slaloming through the mess. Pilgrim #1 passes too close to a corpse: A blade slices h drawing blood. He keeps his mouth shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The passage narrows into a choke-point. Fry sees it first

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddick? RIDDICK? Ahead, a clot of dead predators blocks the canyon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a fucking staircase! Go over it!

dialogues.speaker: GO OVER IT
dialogues.text: Steeling themselves, they start climbing. But Audrey, on all fours, has to discover the corpses wit hands. Then, taking exception at being walked on... One "corpse" snaps at her. Audrey recoils sideways... And tumbles down the mound of corpses. She's exposed. PREDATORS' POV: Rapid-fire images of Audrey. Flashes from different predators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey! Audrey shakes out of it and scrambles for the shield just A predator kamikazes onto the shield, its bone-blades pie the metal... And nearly skewering Audrey beneath. Caught in torchlight, steaming, the PREDATOR HOWLS as it to rip free of the shield. Beneath, Audrey hangs on and takes a thrashing. The predator tears clear, spins, pounces blindly at... Riddick, standing at light's edge. Stunningly, he catches beast under its scythe blades, blunting the attack. The p CLICKS MADLY at him. PREDATOR'S POV: Of Riddick's face. The predator rears back its head, ready to bisect Riddick its skull-blade. Switchblade fast, Riddick drops a hand... ...yanks his shiv... ...and sweeps it over the belly of the beast. HOWLING, th predator falls, disemboweled. REACTION SHOTS of Fry and Imam. Stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't know who he was fuckin' with. They regroup. Imam's head swivels back and forth: They're person short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suleiman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the girl back under. Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: KEEP GOING OR I WILL
dialogues.text: Suddenly Pilgrim #1 reappears, thrust back into the light unseen forces. He's still alive -- but shouldn't be. He m a feeble attempt to grab onto Imam, to anyone, but he's g again before they can even react, jerked out of the light of existence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They flail on. And now, finally...finally.... The canyon widens, opening up like some door to Heaven. T WORST SOUNDS fall behind. We can see it in their sweat-sh faces: The faintest hope that maybe they've survived the Circle of Hell. But then... The TORCHES SPIT AND SPUTTER. Audrey hears PATTERING on the metal shield. Blood falls anew. One torch dies -- yet somehow comes back to life. Imam upturns a hand, checking the liquid for color. But t blood has no hue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, no. No, no, no....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RAIN MONTAGE: Water rilling, running, flowing over rocks ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Caught in a downpour, the survivors slog to a stop. One t goes out -- and won't relight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where the hell's God now, huh? (no answer from Imam)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll tell you where! He's up there

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddick? How close? Riddick sheds goggles to look ahead. We don't know what h sees -- nor what he's thinking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me the settlement is right there!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't make it. HOLD on Fry's anguished face, rendered in dying torchligh Somewhere behind, the AWFUL SOUNDS RETURN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here...hide here.... He's found a crevice in the canyon wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside...inside....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They crawl into the fissure. The second torch dies behind

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's just one light left now -- the one Riddick wears back. By its glow, we watch him lift the shield, muscle i to the crevice...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and slide it over the opening. A black beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why's he still out there? Fry's not sure. Is he protecting them? Or entombing them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Working like Sisyphus, Riddick hauls the cells up a muddy He stops at the top, peers through the rain. RIDDICK'S POV: Of the settlement. Riddick disappears over the rise. The four cells follow, slithering through the mud like a serpent's tail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not coming back, is he? Fry checks Imam's face. <i>Did Riddick say anything to yo wags his head. A bleak beat -- before Fry realizes she ca his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's light in here. It's a soft glow from above. Imam climbs higher to discov small blue-white lights clinging to rocks. He plucks a fe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are they? CLOSE on the lights in Imam's palm. They writhe with life

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Larva....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glow worms....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mind racing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many bottles we got? Empty ones?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddick boards the dark craft. Connects the power cells to the battery bay. Watches the ship come to life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a liquor bottle. It's half full of glow-worms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More, more, we need more.... They climb higher. Little by little, the bottle brightens world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drenched in light, Riddick stands in the hatchway of the looking out into dark rain. Is he struggling with a decis Or just savoring the safe harbor? Then very deliberately. Riddick smashes his handlight on the hull. He steps insid closes the hatch behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something claws its way up the rise. Standing, we see tha Fry, a bottle of glow-worms strung around her neck. Ahead spies... The settlement. Silhouetted by engine-light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the skiffs ENGINES WARM UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Riddick dabbles with flight controls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Fry, running, splashes past buildings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey and Imam huddle around a bottle of glow-worms: Thi all they could harvest. Presently SCRABBLING SOUNDS on th shield. Imam eases one eye to a small hole in the shield. can't see much until... A blade rushes through the hole. Imam recoils hard, snatc the glow-worm light to see... More predator blades exploring the edges of the shield. T light drives them away. For now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riddick dims interior lights, activates exterior lights. actually startled by the sight of... Fry. Standing in the skiffs headbeams. Daring him to run over. Eye-lock. Riddick opens the hatch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They meet at opposite ends of the gangway -- Fry in the r Riddick in the light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Strong survival instinct. Admire that in a woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not leaving. Not until we go back for the others. He laughs at that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promised them we'd go back with more light. And that's exactly what we're gonna do..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think you've mistaken me for somebody who gives a fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What, you're afraid?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Confusin' me with Johns now -- fear was his monkey. I only deal in life and death. All that stuff in between? Some shade of grey my eyes don't see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I trusted you, Riddick. Goddamn, I trusted that some part of you wanted to rejoin the human race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Truthfully? I wouldn't know how. Fry realizes it's impossible to shame a shameless man. Wi desperation edging her voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then wait for me. I'll go back myself. Just give me more light for them. He tosses her a light. The broken one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just come with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got a better idea. Come with me. Fry's mouth moves but nothing comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're already dead. Get on board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fuckin' with me. I know you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Course I am -- but doesn't mean I won't leave you here. If you believe anything about me, better be that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you see, I promised them...I have to...I have to go and.... She's bleeding resolve. Riddick can see it -- can smell i and he keeps slashing away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step aboard, Carolyn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tortured)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't....I can't....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (approaching, extending a hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here. Make it easy on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't do this to me....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me your hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But they...they could still be....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's gonna blame you. C'mon. Take my hand and save yourself, Carolyn. A beat. She takes his hand -- and jerks him down the gang They sprawl through mud. She gets a knee on his neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will not give up on them! I Will not leave anyone on this rock with those fucking things, even if it means -- In a blur, Riddick rolls and slaps a shiv on her neck. Is history repeating itself? Riddick's face, though, is stra calm. Curious. Even gentle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd die for them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would try for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You barely know them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm human. I know you view that as a weakness, but I'm sorry -- I do feel fear, theirs too. Goddamnit, Riddick -- yes. I would die for them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORE SCRABBLING at the shield. Imam cocks his blade back, to do battle with... Fry. She heaves the shield aside. Behind her, Riddick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (big-eyed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You came for us....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah -- we're all fuckin' amazed. Anyone not ready for this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Protected by the meager light of two glow-worm bottles, t remaining survivors head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tighter, tighter....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop. They pile up awkwardly. Fry listens hard. Only RAINFALL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't hear -- He covers her mouth. RIDDICK'S POV: Water has pooled at the base of the muddy A predator drinks there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on his breath)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't see us...wait for it to leave.... RIDDICK'S POV: Another predator lands to drink. Then anot Their backs are to us, but the pool is turning into a maj gathering place. Soon they all can hear CLICKING above the RAIN. Their nig is far from over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get behind me. RIDDICK'S POV: Of a half-dozen predators shifting places pool. A slim gap appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I go, we go. Full-throttle. CLOSE on their hands, gripping each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready...ready.... RIDDICK'S POV: The gap between predators widens into a pa A gauntlet within a gauntlet. Riddick runs. Linked like paper dolls, the others follow RIDDICK'S POV: Of a predator turning to "stare" over its shoulder. PREDATOR'S POV: Of Riddick bearing down fast. The survivors hit the water like lawn mowers on legs, cra through, scattering water and predators alike, managing t reach... The muddy rise. Audrey loses her grip on the others... And starts back-sliding. She CRIES OUT, turning the head Riddick. He catches Audrey as her legs hit the pool. He m her back up the rise and heaves her over the top, sending slip-sliding down the other side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know the way! Not waiting for him, Fry and Imam disappear over the rise RIDDICK'S POV: Of the predators. Regrouping. Crawling up rise at us.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NIGHT
dialogues.text: Fry, Imam, and Audrey run hard, glow-worm lights bouncing RIDDICK'S POV: Chasing them. PREDATOR'S POV: Chasing Riddick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fry, Imam, and Audrey reach the settlement. They spill ar corner and see... The light of the skiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RIDDICK'S POV: Ahead of us, we see Fry, Imam, and Audrey vanishing around the corner. BREATHING LIKE A RACEHORSE, follow in their steps, storming around the same corner. S a predator is right there, right in our face. PREDATOR'S POV: Of Riddick skidding to a stop. He snaps a up. RIDDICK'S POV: Of another predator perched gargoyle-like building. It SPEED-CLICKS at us. PREDATOR'S POV: Of Riddick slowly pulling two shivs. Brac himself. Ready to blade it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Imam and Audrey stagger aboard. Safe in the light of the headbeams, Fry turns back, panting, waiting. Waiting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain.... He wants her to board the skiff. Fry gives it another bea sweeping the dark rain.
